item.title: Do you want to Inspire the next generation of Engineers?
item.description: Attention, Freshmen and Sophomores! Applications are now open for the Engineering Ambassadors! This group has a passion for K-12 Educational Outreach and works with local schools to promote STEM exploration, making engineering more accessible to a younger audience. Please visit the link to our application. Applications close at midnight on January 23, 2026. Contact Recruitment Coordinator, Katie Titus with questions.

item.title: Information Security – Phishing Awareness during the Holiday Break
item.description: Our Information Security team has observed a recurring trend during the holiday season: cybercriminals often target organizations and college campuses with phishing attacks. These emails may contain suspicious links, malicious attachments, or fraudulent websites designed to steal login credentials. Falling victim to such attacks can compromise your device or RCS account, potentially leading to data loss, system instability, and serious security vulnerabilities.

item.title: Apply Now to RPI’s Collegiate Science & Technology Entry Program!
item.description: The Collegiate Science & Technology Entry Program (CSTEP) is excited to announce that applications for the Spring semester are now open! CSTEP is an academic enrichment program designed to support New York State residents who are economically disadvantaged and pursuing careers in STEM or health-related fields. Don’t miss this chance to elevate your academic and professional journey-apply today by visiting here and reach out to InclusiveExcellence@rpi.edu with any questions!

item.title: HelioCampus Spring 2026 Syllabus Available - Complete by January 26, 2026
item.description:
The HelioCampus syllabus module is now available for faculty to access for the spring. Based on the requirements from the Provost’s office, faculty should have their syllabi published in HelioCampus by January 26, 2026. HelioCampus will publish all syllabi automatically on February 2, 2026. Please review post to register for one of the two training sessions that will be offered in January 2026.
